journal-title-group.journal-title: Nebraska Journal of Economics and Business

publisher.publisher-name: College of Business Administration of the University of Nebraska-Lincoln

title-group.article-title: Influence of Socioeconomic Characteristics of Elected Representative Bodies on Governmental Spending Decisions

p.mixed-citation: Roy W. Bahl, "Quantitative Public Expenditure Analysis and Public Policy," National Tax Association, Proceedings of the Sixty-Second Annual Conference on Taxation, 1969, Columbus, Ohio, 1970, pp. 547-569.
Gail R. Wilensky, "Determinants of Local Government Expenditures," in J. P. Crecine, ed., Financing and Metropolis (Beverly Hills: Sage, 1970), pp. 197-218;
Arthur J. Denzau, "An Empirical Study of Studies on Public School Spending," National Tax Journal, June, 1975, pp. 241-249.
William J. Keefe and Morris S. Ogul, The American Legislative Process: Congress and the States (Englewood Cliffs, N.J.: Prentice Hall, 1977);
Malcolm E. Jewell and Samuel C. Patterson, The Legislative Process in the United States (Englewood Cliffs, N.J.: Prentice Hall, 1967).
David R. Derge, "The Lawyer as Decision-Maker in the American State Legisla- ture, "Journal of Politics, August, 1959, pp. 408-433.
Warren E. Miller and Donald E. Stokes, "Constituency Influence in Congress," American Political Science Review, 1963, pp. 45-56.
Lewis A. Dexter, "The Representative and His District," reprinted in Robert L. Peabody and Nelson W. PoLsky, New Perspectives in the House of Representatives (Chicago: Rand-McNally, 1977), pp. 3-25;
Aage R. Clausen, How Congressmen Decide: A Policy Focus (New York: St Martin's Press, 1973), pp. 126-149.
Nicholas P. Lovrich, Jr., and G. Thomas Taylor, Jr., "Neighborhood Evaluation of Local Government Services: A Citizen Survey Approach," Urban Affairs Quarterly, December, 1976, pp. 197-222.
Otto A. Davis, Melvin J. Hinich, and Peter C. Ordeshook, "An Expository Development of a Mathematical Model of the Electoral Process," American Political Science Review, June, 1970, pp. 426-448.

Robert E. Eagle, A Com- parison of Interest Representation in Congressmen and Administrators in National Water Resources Politics, unpublished Ph.D. dissertation, The American University, Washington, D.C. 1967.
